heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 26 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (221°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, a bit warmer for the outside temperature (up 3.5°C), feels like temperature (up 3.3°C), and inside temperature (up 1.6°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 8%) and rainfall (down 0.2 mm).

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 552.9m higher than yesterday, 482.0m higher than the past week, 245.3m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 604m and a high of 2320m, averaging 1604.7m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, the atmosphere will feel parched and dry and little or no wind. Chance of light rain, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and some sunny spells will occur. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
